This causes a rift between Elena and Stefan whereas the relationship between Damon and Elena becomes closer and more intimate. A still loyal Elena, however, refuses to admit her feelings for Damon. In 'Dangerous Liaisons', Elena, frustrated with her feelings for him, tells Damon that his love for her may be a problem, and that this could be causing all their troubles. This incenses Damon, causing him to revert to the uncaring and reckless Damon seen in the previous seasons. The rocky relationship between the two continues until the sexual tension hits the fan and in a moment of heated passion, Elena -- for the first time in the three seasons -- kisses Damon of her own accord. This kiss finally causes Elena to admit that she loves both brothers and realize that she must ultimately make her choice as her own ancestress, Katherine Pierce, who turned the brothers, once did. In assessment of her feelings for Damon, she states this: ``Damon just sort of snuck up on me. He got under my skin and no matter what I do, I can't shake him.'' In the season finale, a trip designed to get her to safety forces Elena to make her choice: to go to Damon and possibly see him one last time; or to go to Stefan and her friends and see them one last time. She chooses the latter when she calls Damon to tell him her decision. Damon, who is trying to stop Alaric, accepts what she says and she tells him that maybe if she had met Damon before she had met Stefan, her choice may have been different. This statement causes Damon to remember the first night he did meet Elena which was, in fact, the night her parents died - before she had met Stefan. Not wanting anyone to know he was in town and after giving her some advice about life and love, Damon compels her to forget. He remembers this as he fights Alaric and seems accepting of his death when Alaric, whose life line is tied to Elena's, suddenly collapses in his arms. Damon is grief-stricken, knowing that this means that Elena has also died and yells, ``No! You are not dead!'' A heartbroken Damon then goes to the hospital demanding to see Elena when the doctor, Meredith Fell, tells him that she gave Elena vampire blood. The last shot of the season finale episode shows Elena in transition.
does damon and elena get together in season 3

In the third season of *The Vampire Diaries*, Damon and Elena do not officially get together as a couple. Although their relationship becomes closer and more intimate, with Elena eventually kissing Damon of her own accord, she struggles with her feelings for both Damon and Stefan. In the season finale, she ultimately chooses to say goodbye to Stefan rather than to Damon, indicating her decision to be with Stefan at that time. However, the complicated dynamics and strong emotions between Damon and Elena continue, setting the stage for further developments in their relationship in the following seasons.

Shaquem Alphonso Griffin /ʃəˈkiːm/ (born July 20, 1995) is an American football linebacker for the Seattle Seahawks of the National Football League (NFL). He is the twin brother of Seahawks cornerback Shaquill Griffin, and both brothers played college football for the University of Central Florida Knights. As an amputee with one hand, Shaquem Griffin received extensive media coverage as a prospective 2018 NFL Draft pick. He was selected as a fifth round pick (141st overall) by the Seahawks on April 28, 2018, reuniting him with Shaquill.

Yes, "The Other Boleyn Girl" is part of a series known as the Tudor Court series by Philippa Gregory. The series includes several novels set during the Tudor period, focusing on key figures and events. "The Queen's Fool" and "The Virgin's Lover," which you mentioned, are also part of this series. While each book can typically be read as a standalone, they are connected by their historical context and shared characters from the Tudor era.

The Himalayan range has many of the Earth's highest peaks, including the highest, Mount Everest. The Himalayas include over fifty mountains exceeding 7,200 metres (23,600 ft) in elevation, including ten of the fourteen 8,000-metre peaks. By contrast, the highest peak outside Asia (Aconcagua, in the Andes) is 6,961 metres (22,838 ft) tall.
is mount everest a part of the himalayas

samples.input:
EMT-I/85 is a level of EMT-I training formulated by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians in 1985. This training level includes more invasive procedures than are covered at the EMT-Basic level, including IV therapy, the use of advanced airway devices, and provides for advanced assessment skills. The EMT-I/85 typically administered the same medications as an EMT-B (oxygen, oral glucose, activated charcoal, epinephrine auto-injectors (EpiPens), nitroglycerin, and metered-dose inhalers such as albuterol). However, in some states they were also allowed to administer naloxone, D50, and glucagon. Like all other EMT levels, their scope of practice was governed by the state and/or their Medical Director.
can an emt-basic start an iv

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

EMT-I/85 is a level of EMT-I training formulated by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians in 1985. This training level includes more invasive procedures than are covered at the EMT-Basic level, including IV therapy, the use of advanced airway devices, and provides for advanced assessment skills. The EMT-I/85 typically administered the same medications as an EMT-B (oxygen, oral glucose, activated charcoal, epinephrine auto-injectors (EpiPens), nitroglycerin, and metered-dose inhalers such as albuterol). However, in some states they were also allowed to administer naloxone, D50, and glucagon. Like all other EMT levels, their scope of practice was governed by the state and/or their Medical Director.
can an emt-basic start an iv

No, an EMT-Basic (EMT-B) is generally not permitted to start an IV. The scope of practice for EMT-Basics typically includes providing basic life support such as CPR, administering oxygen, and managing bleeding, among other fundamental emergency medical care skills. More invasive procedures like starting an IV are usually reserved for higher-level EMTs, such as EMT-Intermediates or Paramedics, depending on the state regulations. Always check the state-specific regulations or guidelines from the Medical Director for the precise scope of practice, as these can vary.

samples.input:
The following is the list of teams to overcome 3--1 series deficits by winning three straight games to win a best-of-seven playoff series. In the history of major North American pro sports, teams that were down 3--1 in the series came back and won the series 52 times, more than half of them were accomplished by National Hockey League (NHL) teams. Teams overcame 3--1 deficit in the final championship round eight times, six were accomplished by Major League Baseball (MLB) teams in the World Series. Teams overcoming 3--0 deficit by winning four straight games were accomplished five times, four times in the NHL and once in MLB.
has anyone come back from 3-0 in the nba finals

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

The following is the list of teams to overcome 3--1 series deficits by winning three straight games to win a best-of-seven playoff series. In the history of major North American pro sports, teams that were down 3--1 in the series came back and won the series 52 times, more than half of them were accomplished by National Hockey League (NHL) teams. Teams overcame 3--1 deficit in the final championship round eight times, six were accomplished by Major League Baseball (MLB) teams in the World Series. Teams overcoming 3--0 deficit by winning four straight games were accomplished five times, four times in the NHL and once in MLB.
has anyone come back from 3-0 in the nba finals

As of now, no team in NBA history has ever come back from a 3-0 deficit to win a playoff series, including the NBA Finals. While there have been instances where teams have forced a Game 7 after being down 3-0, none have succeeded in winning the series. The NBA remains unique among the major North American sports leagues in that it has never seen a successful comeback from a 3-0 series deficit.

samples.input:
Radio waves are a type of electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths in the electromagnetic spectrum longer than infrared light. Radio waves have frequencies as high as 300 gigahertz (GHz) to as low as 30 hertz (Hz). At 300 GHz, the corresponding wavelength is 1 mm, and at 30 Hz is 10,000 km. Like all other electromagnetic waves, radio waves travel at the speed of light. They are generated by electric charges undergoing acceleration, such as time varying electric currents. Naturally occurring radio waves are emitted by lightning and astronomical objects.
do radio waves travel at the speed of light

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Radio waves are a type of electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths in the electromagnetic spectrum longer than infrared light. Radio waves have frequencies as high as 300 gigahertz (GHz) to as low as 30 hertz (Hz). At 300 GHz, the corresponding wavelength is 1 mm, and at 30 Hz is 10,000 km. Like all other electromagnetic waves, radio waves travel at the speed of light. They are generated by electric charges undergoing acceleration, such as time varying electric currents. Naturally occurring radio waves are emitted by lightning and astronomical objects.
do radio waves travel at the speed of light

Yes, radio waves do travel at the speed of light. In a vacuum, the speed of light is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second (or about 300,000 kilometers per second). Since radio waves are a form of electromagnetic radiation, they propagate through space at this speed, just like other forms of electromagnetic waves, such as visible light, infrared, ultraviolet, X-rays, and gamma rays. When traveling through different mediums, like air or water, their speed can be slightly less due to the medium's refractive index. However, in a vacuum, they always travel at the speed of light.

An acute triangle is a triangle with all three angles acute (less than 90°). An obtuse triangle is one with one obtuse angle (greater than 90°) and two acute angles. Since a triangle's angles must sum to 180°, no triangle can have more than one obtuse angle.
do all triangles have at least two acute angles

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

An acute triangle is a triangle with all three angles acute (less than 90°). An obtuse triangle is one with one obtuse angle (greater than 90°) and two acute angles. Since a triangle's angles must sum to 180°, no triangle can have more than one obtuse angle.
do all triangles have at least two acute angles

Yes, all triangles must have at least two acute angles. This is because the sum of the angles in any triangle is always 180 degrees. If a triangle has one right angle, which is 90 degrees, the other two angles must sum to 90 degrees and therefore both must be acute. Similarly, if a triangle has one obtuse angle (greater than 90 degrees), the other two angles must sum to less than 90 degrees, which means they both have to be acute. Hence, all triangles have at least two acute angles.

samples.input:
The University of Mary Hardin--Baylor (UMHB) is a Christian co-educational institution of higher learning located in Belton, Texas, United States. UMHB was chartered by the Republic of Texas in 1845 as Baylor Female College, the female department of what is now Baylor University. It has since become its own institution and grown to 3,914 students and awards degrees at the baccalaureate, master's, and doctoral levels. It is affiliated with the Baptist General Convention of Texas.
is baylor and mary hardin baylor the same school

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

The University of Mary Hardin--Baylor (UMHB) is a Christian co-educational institution of higher learning located in Belton, Texas, United States. UMHB was chartered by the Republic of Texas in 1845 as Baylor Female College, the female department of what is now Baylor University. It has since become its own institution and grown to 3,914 students and awards degrees at the baccalaureate, master's, and doctoral levels. It is affiliated with the Baptist General Convention of Texas.
is baylor and mary hardin baylor the same school

No, Baylor University and the University of Mary Hardin-Baylor (UMHB) are not the same school, although they share historical connections. Originally, UMHB started as Baylor Female College, the female department of Baylor University, when it was chartered by the Republic of Texas in 1845. Over time, it became its own institution, while Baylor University remained a separate entity. Today, UMHB is an independent Christian university located in Belton, Texas, while Baylor University is located in Waco, Texas. Despite their historical ties and Baptist affiliations, they operate independently of each other.

Capital punishment for juveniles in the United States existed until March 1, 2005, when the U.S. Supreme Court banned it in Roper v. Simmons.
can you get the death penalty as a minor

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Capital punishment for juveniles in the United States existed until March 1, 2005, when the U.S. Supreme Court banned it in Roper v. Simmons.
can you get the death penalty as a minor

No, minors cannot receive the death penalty in the United States. The U.S. Supreme Court's decision in Roper v. Simmons on March 1, 2005, ruled that imposing the death penalty on individuals who were under 18 at the time of their crime is unconstitutional, as it violates the Eighth Amendment's ban on cruel and unusual punishment. Therefore, juvenile offenders cannot be sentenced to death.

samples.input:
India has never participated in the FIFA World Cup, although the team did qualify by default for the 1950 World Cup after all the other nations in their qualification group withdrew. However, India withdrew prior to the beginning of the tournament. The team has also appeared three times in the Asia's top football competition, the AFC Asian Cup. Their best result in the competition occurred in 1964 when the team finished as runners-up. India also participate in the SAFF Championship, the top regional football competition in South Asia. They have won the tournament six times since it began in 1993.

samples.input:
Tyrannosaurus is a genus of coelurosaurian theropod dinosaur. The species Tyrannosaurus rex (rex meaning ``king'' in Latin), often colloquially called simply T. rex or T-Rex, is one of the most well-represented of the large theropods. Tyrannosaurus lived throughout what is now western North America, on what was then an island continent known as Laramidia. Tyrannosaurus had a much wider range than other tyrannosaurids. Fossils are found in a variety of rock formations dating to the Maastrichtian age of the upper Cretaceous Period, 68 to 66 million years ago. It was the last known member of the tyrannosaurids, and among the last non-avian dinosaurs to exist before the Cretaceous--Paleogene extinction event.
are t rex and tyrannosaurus rex the same

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

are t rex and tyrannosaurus rex the same

Yes, T. rex and Tyrannosaurus rex refer to the same species. "T. rex" is simply a commonly used abbreviation of the full scientific name, Tyrannosaurus rex. The "T" stands for the genus name, Tyrannosaurus, and "rex" is the species name, meaning "king" in Latin. Both terms describe the same large theropod dinosaur that lived during the late Cretaceous period.

The new locks opened for commercial traffic on 26 June 2016, and the first ship to cross the canal using the third set of locks was a modern New Panamax vessel, the Chinese-owned container ship Cosco Shipping Panama. The original locks, now over 100 years old, allow engineers greater access for maintenance, and are projected to continue operating indefinitely.
is the old panama canal still in use

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

The new locks opened for commercial traffic on 26 June 2016, and the first ship to cross the canal using the third set of locks was a modern New Panamax vessel, the Chinese-owned container ship Cosco Shipping Panama. The original locks, now over 100 years old, allow engineers greater access for maintenance, and are projected to continue operating indefinitely.
is the old panama canal still in use

Yes, the original locks of the Panama Canal are still in use. Despite being over 100 years old, they continue to operate alongside the newer locks. The original locks are maintained and provide vital passage for vessels that are smaller than the New Panamax size, allowing for efficient traffic management and maintenance flexibility.

samples.input:
A possession and acquisition licence is a licence that allows individuals in Canada to possess and acquire firearms as well as ammunition. Licences are typically valid for five years and must be renewed prior to expiry to maintain all classes. If an individual possessing a PAL is convicted of certain offences, a PAL can be revoked. If an individual does not renew their PAL prior to its expiration date or if they have their PAL revoked, they must legally dispose of any firearms in their possession. A licence for prohibited firearms can be issued to qualifying businesses, and very rarely to individuals (firearms they own, as the gun laws changed over time.) Previous convictions for serious violent, drug or weapons offences almost invariably result in the denial of the application.
do you need a pal to possess ammunition

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

A possession and acquisition licence is a licence that allows individuals in Canada to possess and acquire firearms as well as ammunition. Licences are typically valid for five years and must be renewed prior to expiry to maintain all classes. If an individual possessing a PAL is convicted of certain offences, a PAL can be revoked. If an individual does not renew their PAL prior to its expiration date or if they have their PAL revoked, they must legally dispose of any firearms in their possession. A licence for prohibited firearms can be issued to qualifying businesses, and very rarely to individuals (firearms they own, as the gun laws changed over time.) Previous convictions for serious violent, drug or weapons offences almost invariably result in the denial of the application.
do you need a pal to possess ammunition

samples.input:
Typically, once spun, cotton candy is only marketed by color. Absent a clear name other than 'blue', the distinctive taste of the blue raspberry flavor mix has gone on to become a compound flavor that some other foods (gum, ice cream, rock candy, fluoride toothpaste) occasionally borrow (``cotton-candy flavored ice cream'') to invoke the nostalgia of cotton candy that people typically only get to experience on vacation or holidays. Pink bubble gum went through a similar transition from specific branded product to a generic flavor that transcended the original confection, and 'bubble gum flavor' often shows up in the same product categories as 'cotton candy flavor'.
do blue and pink cotton candy taste the same

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

do blue and pink cotton candy taste the same

While blue and pink cotton candy can look similar, they typically have different flavors. Blue cotton candy is usually flavored as blue raspberry, while pink cotton candy often comes with a more traditional vanilla or subtle sweet flavor, sometimes likened to pink vanilla or even strawberry. The colors and associated flavors have become iconic, creating a sense of nostalgia and making them popular in various confectionery and novelty food products. The flavors are distinct, which is why they're used to create different sensory experiences, even in non-cotton candy products.

samples.input:
A floating island is a mass of floating aquatic plants, mud, and peat ranging in thickness from several centimetres to a few metres. Floating islands are a common natural phenomenon that are found in many parts of the world. They exist less commonly as a man-made phenomenon. Floating islands are generally found on marshlands, lakes, and similar wetland locations, and can be many hectares in size.
is there such a thing as a floating island

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

A floating island is a mass of floating aquatic plants, mud, and peat ranging in thickness from several centimetres to a few metres. Floating islands are a common natural phenomenon that are found in many parts of the world. They exist less commonly as a man-made phenomenon. Floating islands are generally found on marshlands, lakes, and similar wetland locations, and can be many hectares in size.
is there such a thing as a floating island

Yes, floating islands do exist both naturally and as man-made structures. Natural floating islands are typically composed of dense mats of aquatic plants, mud, and peat, and they can be found in marshlands, lakes, and wetlands around the world. These islands can range in size from just a few square meters to many hectares. Man-made floating islands have also been created for various purposes, such as environmental protection, bioremediation, and even for recreational use.

samples.input:
Males, if not neutered, are extremely musky. It is considered preferable to delay neutering until sexual maturity has been reached, at approximately six to eight months old, after the full descent of the testicles. Neutering the male will reduce the smell to almost nothing. The same applies for females, but spaying them is also important for their own health. Unless they are going to be used for breeding purposes, female ferrets will go into extended heat. A female that does not mate can die of aplastic anemia without medical intervention. It is possible to use a vasectomised male to take a female out of heat.
do female ferrets die if they don't mate

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Males, if not neutered, are extremely musky. It is considered preferable to delay neutering until sexual maturity has been reached, at approximately six to eight months old, after the full descent of the testicles. Neutering the male will reduce the smell to almost nothing. The same applies for females, but spaying them is also important for their own health. Unless they are going to be used for breeding purposes, female ferrets will go into extended heat. A female that does not mate can die of aplastic anemia without medical intervention. It is possible to use a vasectomised male to take a female out of heat.
do female ferrets die if they don't mate

Yes, female ferrets can suffer serious health issues if they do not mate while in heat, due to a condition known as aplastic anemia. When female ferrets (jills) enter heat, their bodies produce high levels of estrogen. If they do not mate and become pregnant, these elevated hormone levels can persist for an extended period, leading to bone marrow suppression. This suppression can result in aplastic anemia, a potentially life-threatening condition.

To prevent this, ferret owners typically either spay their female ferrets or use a vasectomized male ferret to mate with the female, which will take her out of heat without resulting in pregnancy. Spaying is generally recommended not only to prevent health issues but also to manage the ferret population responsibly.

samples.input:
The Xbox One gaming console has received updates from Microsoft since its launch in 2013 that enable it to play select games from its two predecessor consoles, Xbox and Xbox 360. On June 15, 2015, backward compatibility with supported Xbox 360 games became available to eligible Xbox Preview program users with a beta update to the Xbox One system software. The dashboard update containing backward compatibility was released publicly on November 12, 2015. On October 24, 2017, another such update added games from the original Xbox library. The following is a list of all backward compatible games on Xbox One under this functionality.
will all xbox 360 games work on xbox one

will all xbox 360 games work on xbox one

samples.input:
There is no brachiocephalic artery for the left side of the body. The left common carotid, and the left subclavian artery, come directly off the aortic arch. However, there are two brachiocephalic veins.
is there a right and left brachiocephalic artery

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

There is no brachiocephalic artery for the left side of the body. The left common carotid, and the left subclavian artery, come directly off the aortic arch. However, there are two brachiocephalic veins.
is there a right and left brachiocephalic artery

No, there is only one brachiocephalic artery, also known as the brachiocephalic trunk or the innominate artery, and it is on the right side of the body. The brachiocephalic artery branches off the aortic arch and subsequently divides into the right subclavian artery and the right common carotid artery. On the left side, the left common carotid artery and the left subclavian artery arise directly from the aortic arch without a brachiocephalic trunk. However, there are two brachiocephalic veins—one on the right and one on the left—which join to form the superior vena cava.

samples.input:
The Sole Survivor receives a cash prize of $1,000,000 prior to taxes and sometimes also receives a car provided by the show's sponsor. Every player receives a prize for participating on Survivor depending on how long he or she lasts in the game. In most seasons, the runner-up receives $100,000, and third place wins $85,000. All other players receive money on a sliding scale, though specific amounts have rarely been made public. Sonja Christopher, the first player voted off of Survivor: Borneo, received $2,500. In Survivor: Fiji, the first season with tied runners-up, the two runners-up received US$100,000 each, and Yau-Man Chan received US$60,000 for his fourth-place finish. All players also receive an additional $10,000 for their appearance on the reunion show.
do the runners up on survivor win money

will there be a second season of 11.22.63

samples.input:
Nuclear power in the United States is provided by 99 commercial reactors with a net capacity of 100,350 megawatts (MW), 65 pressurized water reactors and 34 boiling water reactors. In 2016 they produced a total of 805.3 terawatt-hours of electricity, which accounted for 19.7% of the nation's total electric energy generation. In 2016, nuclear energy comprised nearly 60 percent of U.S. emission-free generation.
are there nuclear power plants in the us

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Nuclear power in the United States is provided by 99 commercial reactors with a net capacity of 100,350 megawatts (MW), 65 pressurized water reactors and 34 boiling water reactors. In 2016 they produced a total of 805.3 terawatt-hours of electricity, which accounted for 19.7% of the nation's total electric energy generation. In 2016, nuclear energy comprised nearly 60 percent of U.S. emission-free generation.
are there nuclear power plants in the us

Yes, there are nuclear power plants in the United States. As of the data you referenced, the U.S. had 99 commercial nuclear reactors located at various sites across the country. These reactors are divided into two types: 65 pressurized water reactors (PWRs) and 34 boiling water reactors (BWRs). Nuclear power contributes a significant portion of the nation's electricity supply and plays a crucial role in providing emission-free energy. Since the data is from 2016, the number of reactors might have changed slightly due to new plants coming online or older plants being decommissioned.

samples.input:
The tiebreak is sometimes not employed for the final set of a match and an advantage set is used instead. Therefore, the deciding set must be played until one player or team has won two more games than the opponent. This is true in three of the four major tennis championships, all except the US Open where a tiebreak is played even in the deciding set (fifth set for the men, third set for the women) at 6--6. A tiebreak is not played in the deciding set in the other three majors -- the Australian Open, the French Open, and Wimbledon. (When the tiebreak was first introduced at Wimbledon in 1971, it was invoked at 8--8 rather than 6--6.) The US Open holds ``Super Saturday'' where the two men's semi-finals are played along with the women's final on the second Saturday of the event; therefore a tie-break is more prudent where player rest and scheduling is more important.
is there a tiebreaker in final set at wimbledon

is there a tiebreaker in final set at wimbledon

As of the 2019 Wimbledon Championships, a tiebreaker is used in the final set at Wimbledon if the score reaches 12-12. Prior to 2019, Wimbledon employed an advantage set, but the rule was changed to prevent extremely long matches. This rule applies to both the men's and women's singles matches.

samples.input:
The original World Trade Center was a large complex of seven buildings in Lower Manhattan, New York City, United States. It featured the landmark Twin Towers, which opened on April 4, 1973 and were destroyed in 2001 during the September 11 attacks. At the time of their completion, the Twin Towers -- the original 1 World Trade Center, at 1,368 feet (417 m); and 2 World Trade Center, at 1,362 feet (415.1 m) -- were the tallest buildings in the world. Other buildings in the complex included the Marriott World Trade Center (3 WTC), 4 WTC, 5 WTC, 6 WTC, and 7 WTC. The complex was located in New York City's Financial District and contained 13,400,000 square feet (1,240,000 m) of office space.
were the twin towers the world trade center

Sanders played football primarily at cornerback, but also as a kick returner, punt returner, and occasionally wide receiver. He played in the National Football League (NFL) for the Atlanta Falcons, the San Francisco 49ers, the Dallas Cowboys, the Washington Redskins and the Baltimore Ravens, winning the Super Bowl with both the 49ers and the Cowboys. An outfielder in baseball, he played professionally for the New York Yankees, the Atlanta Braves, the Cincinnati Reds and the San Francisco Giants, and participated in the 1992 World Series with the Braves. He attended Florida State University, where he was recognized as a two-time All-American in football, and also played baseball and ran track.

samples.input:
The German Shepherd (German: Deutscher Schäferhund, German pronunciation: (ˈʃɛːfɐˌhʊnt)) is a breed of medium to large-sized working dog that originated in Germany. The breed's officially recognized name is German Shepherd Dog in the English language (sometimes abbreviated as GSD). The breed is known as the Alsatian in Britain and Ireland. The German Shepherd is a relatively new breed of dog, with their origin dating to 1899. As part of the Herding Group, German Shepherds are working dogs developed originally for herding sheep. Since that time however, because of their strength, intelligence, trainability, and obedience, German Shepherds around the world are often the preferred breed for many types of work, including disability assistance, search-and-rescue, police and military roles, and even acting. The German Shepherd is the second-most registered breed by the American Kennel Club and seventh-most registered breed by The Kennel Club in the United Kingdom.
is a german shepard the same as an alsatian

is a german shepard the same as an alsatian

Yes, a German Shepherd and an Alsatian refer to the same breed of dog. The name "Alsatian" was originally used in Britain and Ireland as an alternative to "German Shepherd" due to anti-German sentiment after World War I. Over time, both names have been used interchangeably, but "German Shepherd" is the more commonly used term globally today.

While some 19th-century experiments suggested that the underlying premise is true if the heating is sufficiently gradual, according to contemporary biologists the premise is false: a frog that is gradually heated will jump out. Indeed, thermoregulation by changing location is a fundamentally necessary survival strategy for frogs and other ectotherms.
does a frog jump out of boiling water

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

While some 19th-century experiments suggested that the underlying premise is true if the heating is sufficiently gradual, according to contemporary biologists the premise is false: a frog that is gradually heated will jump out. Indeed, thermoregulation by changing location is a fundamentally necessary survival strategy for frogs and other ectotherms.
does a frog jump out of boiling water

The notion that a frog will stay in gradually heated water until it boils is a myth. In reality, if the water is heated slowly, a frog will try to escape when it becomes uncomfortably warm. Frogs, like other ectotherms, rely on external sources of heat to regulate their body temperature and will move to a more comfortable environment if possible. The myth likely serves as a metaphor for complacency in the face of gradual danger, but it doesn't accurately reflect a frog's behavior in real life.

samples.input:
In high-energy particle colliders, matter creation events have yielded a wide variety of exotic heavy particles precipitating out of colliding photon jets (see two-photon physics). Currently, two-photon physics studies creation of various fermion pairs both theoretically and experimentally (using particle accelerators, air showers, radioactive isotopes, etc.).
is it possible to create mass from energy

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

In high-energy particle colliders, matter creation events have yielded a wide variety of exotic heavy particles precipitating out of colliding photon jets (see two-photon physics). Currently, two-photon physics studies creation of various fermion pairs both theoretically and experimentally (using particle accelerators, air showers, radioactive isotopes, etc.).
is it possible to create mass from energy

Yes, it is possible to create mass from energy, and this is a fundamental concept in physics, encapsulated by Einstein's famous equation \(E=mc^2\). In high-energy physics, this principle is utilized in particle colliders, where particles with high kinetic energy collide, converting kinetic energy into mass and resulting in the creation of new particles. This process is a direct demonstration of mass-energy equivalence.

In particular, two-photon physics, which you've mentioned, is a fascinating domain where two high-energy photons interact. Although photons are massless, their energy can be transformed into mass when they collide under certain conditions, producing particle-antiparticle pairs, such as electron-positron pairs. This phenomenon illustrates the conversion of energy into mass and is an area of active research both theoretically and experimentally. 

Colliders like the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) and others are central to these studies, revealing the properties of fundamental particles and sometimes discovering new, exotic states of matter.

In high-energy physics, this principle is utilized in particle colliders, where particles with high kinetic energy collide, converting kinetic energy into mass and resulting in the creation of new particles. This process is a direct demonstration of mass-energy equivalence.

In particular, two-photon physics, which you've mentioned, is a fascinating domain where two high-energy photons interact. Although photons are massless, their energy can be transformed into mass when they collide under certain conditions, producing particle-antiparticle pairs, such as electron-positron pairs. This phenomenon illustrates the conversion of energy into mass and is an area of active research both theoretically and experimentally. 

Colliders like the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) and others are central to these studies, revealing the properties of fundamental particles and sometimes discovering new, exotic states of matter.

Language detected: en,
Expected language: de

From model years 1999 to 2002, the rear-wheel-drive S-Type was equipped with either a five-speed manual (Getrag 221) or a five-speed J-Gate Ford 5R55N transmission . From 2003, the S-Type was produced with either a 5-speed manual transmission or a six-speed J-Gate transmission that allows automatic gear selection or clutchless manual gear selection. The 2004 diesel saw the introduction of a 6-speed manual transmission; it was also available with the six-speed J-Gate automatic transmission.
is the jaguar s type rear wheel drive

samples.input:
As a unit of culinary measure, a level dessertspoon (dstspn.) equals two teaspoons, or 10 milliliters, whereas a U.S. tablespoon is three teaspoons (15ml or half a fluid ounce) in the U.S., and two dessertspoons, i.e. four teaspoons (20ml or two thirds of a fluid ounce) in Britain and Australia, which is the old British standard. For dry ingredients, a rounded or heaped teaspoonful is often specified instead.
is a tablespoon bigger than a dessert spoon

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

As a unit of culinary measure, a level dessertspoon (dstspn.) equals two teaspoons, or 10 milliliters, whereas a U.S. tablespoon is three teaspoons (15ml or half a fluid ounce) in the U.S., and two dessertspoons, i.e. four teaspoons (20ml or two thirds of a fluid ounce) in Britain and Australia, which is the old British standard. For dry ingredients, a rounded or heaped teaspoonful is often specified instead.
is a tablespoon bigger than a dessert spoon

Yes, a tablespoon is typically bigger than a dessertspoon. In the U.S., a tablespoon is equal to three teaspoons, which is about 15 milliliters. In Britain and Australia, a tablespoon is usually equal to four teaspoons, which is about 20 milliliters. A dessertspoon, on the other hand, is equal to two teaspoons, which is about 10 milliliters. Thus, regardless of the standard used, a tablespoon holds more than a dessertspoon.

samples.input:
A dorsal root ganglion (or spinal ganglion) (also known as a posterior root ganglion), is a cluster of neurons (a ganglion) in a dorsal root of a spinal nerve. The cell bodies of sensory neurons known as first-order neurons are located in the dorsal root ganglia.
does the dorsal root ganglion carry sensory input

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

A dorsal root ganglion (or spinal ganglion) (also known as a posterior root ganglion), is a cluster of neurons (a ganglion) in a dorsal root of a spinal nerve. The cell bodies of sensory neurons known as first-order neurons are located in the dorsal root ganglia.
does the dorsal root ganglion carry sensory input

Yes, the dorsal root ganglion carries sensory input. It contains the cell bodies of sensory neurons, also known as first-order neurons, which are responsible for transmitting sensory information from the peripheral nervous system to the central nervous system. Sensory input, such as touch, pain, temperature, and proprioception, is conveyed through these neurons, with their axons forming part of the dorsal roots that connect to the spinal cord.

samples.input:
Angular frequency (or angular speed) is the magnitude of the vector quantity angular velocity. The term angular frequency vector ω → (\displaystyle (\vec (\omega ))) is sometimes used as a synonym for the vector quantity angular velocity.
is angular frequency and angular velocity the same

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Angular frequency (or angular speed) is the magnitude of the vector quantity angular velocity. The term angular frequency vector ω → (\displaystyle (\vec (\omega ))) is sometimes used as a synonym for the vector quantity angular velocity.
is angular frequency and angular velocity the same

Angular frequency and angular velocity are closely related concepts, but they are not exactly the same.

1. **Angular Frequency (ω)**: This is a scalar quantity that represents how many radians an object covers per unit time. It is commonly used in the context of oscillatory motion, such as simple harmonic motion, and is often expressed in radians per second (rad/s).

2. **Angular Velocity (ω →)**: This is a vector quantity that not only indicates how fast something is rotating but also the direction of the axis of rotation. The magnitude of the angular velocity vector is equal to the angular frequency.

In summary, the angular frequency is the magnitude of the angular velocity vector. While angular frequency gives the rate of rotation, angular velocity includes both the rate and the direction of the rotation.

samples.input:
Bullets fired into the air usually fall back with terminal velocities much lower than their muzzle velocity when they leave the barrel of a firearm. Nevertheless, people can be injured, sometimes fatally, when bullets discharged into the air fall back down to the ground. Bullets fired at angles less than vertical are more dangerous as the bullet maintains its angular ballistic trajectory and is far less likely to engage in tumbling motion; it therefore travels at speeds much higher than a bullet in free fall.
can someone die from a bullet shot in the air

messages.content: You are Albatross, responding to a user

Bullets fired into the air usually fall back with terminal velocities much lower than their muzzle velocity when they leave the barrel of a firearm. Nevertheless, people can be injured, sometimes fatally, when bullets discharged into the air fall back down to the ground. Bullets fired at angles less than vertical are more dangerous as the bullet maintains its angular ballistic trajectory and is far less likely to engage in tumbling motion; it therefore travels at speeds much higher than a bullet in free fall.
can someone die from a bullet shot in the air

Yes, someone can indeed die from a bullet shot into the air. When a bullet is fired into the air, it can reach significant altitudes before it starts to fall back to the ground due to gravity. Although it loses much of its initial velocity and falls at a lower speed, typically reaching terminal velocity, it can still achieve speeds fast enough to penetrate human skin and cause serious injury or even death.

Bullets fired at angles other than vertical can be particularly dangerous. These bullets maintain more of their velocity because they continue in a ballistic trajectory rather than reaching a complete stop at the peak of their ascent, which means they are not subject to the same degree of deceleration and can hit the ground—or a person—with much greater force.

Firing bullets into the air is a dangerous practice and is illegal in many places due to the risk of injury or death it poses. It is important to always handle firearms responsibly and to consider the potential consequences of where bullets might land.

samples.input:
Salt Lake City (often shortened to Salt Lake and abbreviated as SLC) is the capital and the most populous municipality of the U.S. state of Utah. With an estimated population of 190,884 in 2014, the city is the core of the Salt Lake City metropolitan area, which has a population of 1,153,340 (2014 estimate). Salt Lake City is further situated within a larger metropolis known as the Salt Lake City--Ogden--Provo Combined Statistical Area. This region is a corridor of contiguous urban and suburban development stretched along an approximately 120-mile (190 km) segment of the Wasatch Front, comprising a population of 2,423,912 as of 2014. It is one of only two major urban areas in the Great Basin (the other is Reno, Nevada).
is salt lake city the biggest city in utah

is salt lake city the biggest city in utah

Yes, Salt Lake City is the largest city in Utah in terms of population. It is the capital and serves as the cultural, economic, and political center of the state. While the city itself is the most populous municipality, the larger Salt Lake City metropolitan area and the Salt Lake City–Ogden–Provo Combined Statistical Area are significant urban and suburban regions in Utah.

samples.input:
On Isla Sorna, an island off the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, a young girl named Cathy Bowman wanders around during a family vacation, and survives an attack by a swarm of Compsognathus. Her parents file a lawsuit against the genetics company InGen, now headed by John Hammond's nephew, Peter Ludlow, who plans to use Isla Sorna to alleviate the financial losses imposed by the incident that occurred at Jurassic Park four years earlier. Mathematician Dr. Ian Malcolm meets Hammond at his mansion. Hammond explains that Isla Sorna, abandoned years earlier during a hurricane, is where InGen created their dinosaurs before moving them to Jurassic Park on Isla Nublar. Hammond hopes to stop InGen by sending a team to Isla Sorna to document the dinosaurs, thus causing public support against human interference on the island. Ian, who survived the Jurassic Park disaster, is reluctant. After learning that his girlfriend, paleontologist Dr. Sarah Harding, is part of the team and is already on Isla Sorna, Ian agrees to go to the island, but only to retrieve her.
did the girl in the lost world die
